column5: Thanks for the report all. Looks like a good time, perhaps next year will favour me and I'll be able to participate.

Ya..  I didn't want to say anything to stir the pot. But I caught that big eye outta the whole Randy was fishing from all day..  If Randy wasn't so busy cooking dogs all day, he would have caught a lot more fish for sure!
I won't hold it against him.
and I was only fishing from one hole 'til 1:30... NAW was kind enough to open another one up for me. It didn't help   Randy

sounds like a great time was had by all. Wish i could have made it, had to work 7 am to 11pm on  a transport rollover on hwy 11 N       regardless of being able to make it or not thank you kindly for the invite.  Matt

It was super to meet new board members today. At the GTG was: T.J. Randy From Sturgeon Lady Walleye (Shelley) Rodcaster (Chad) and his girlfriend Sara Spud7378 (Kevin) NAW (Nick) Jocko (Hans) and his friend Harv Rides85 (Andrew) Joeytier (Joey) and his friend (joining the board SOON) and myself  It was a great day to be out on the lake and although fishing could have been better the bites were fairly constant through the day.      We had a snack of fried fish     Randy brought his special friend   Joeytier caught the only 2 walleyes of the day.   and I tried my best to fish like Limeyangler but only managed herring and perch.   Congratulations to NAW who took home $15 for the most fish caught. He also one a free nights accomodations in my hut tonight. He texted me and will have a cell phone picture of the 25" HOG walleye he caught tonight around 10pm. It was released.   We never did measure the herring but at the end of the day we figure Jocko's friend Harv caught the biggest one. We had a good pike through the hole but it broke off and went back down.  Once again, thanks to all who made it out I had a great day.
It would have been great to have you out there today Matt. We'll hook up sometime.
I should learn to open my eyes.  I had a feeling Nick would pop a good fish out there. Nice shootin

great to meet everyone yesterday, even know i did only contribute 4 fish all day! thanks again to blair for putting together the day and randy for the cooking! and tj for the great prizes! had a great time!

I sure was fun!!!.... Nice meeting everyone... I must apologize for only catching 1 measly Perch , but it was fun anyway.  I thought that I took tons of pics but turns out that I took 37 fuzzy 1 second videos  Rod Caster, do you have that Artie in the snowsuit picture available.

Hey guys,  Im Brendan, the guy who came out with Joeytier. Saturday was a great day on the ice. Thaks to everyone for coming out and especially to Blair for the top notch hospitality!. It was great to meet everyone!  Here are a few pictures from saturday.  Joey with his trophy of the day    My two fish of the day    The hut    First time driving on the ice!

Yes I have that photo, I'll post it here in the next...well, soon. Just got home from Loring. Sooooo much fishing in the past 48 hrs and I plan on hitting the shack again tonight.  Thanks to Blair and TJ and all the participants! Sarah and I had a great time. I'll post my photos later today. How did the Herring taste and how did you guys cook it???? Very interested in knowing whether they are worth keeping next time. Congrats to Joeytier on the two walleye!!! You spanked everyone hahaha.

Hey guys, glad you got together and got some fish. Being from Nord Bay originally, I would have liked to make it.  I wonder if a separate post should be started to post the photos from the day? Some of the other members may not think to check the OP to see photos.
I edited the subject Rob. Will that help?
Rod Caster, I had a few chunks of the herring and was pretty impressed.  It's similar in texture to whitefish, just a little more oily and fishy.
It was great to get out and see everyone!! Ill have some pictures shortly!!

Swag..  I've always wanted some OFC swag..  Big thanks to TJ for dropping that stuff off!  And thanks Blair for setting things up, and letting me use the shack for the night.  It was great to pull a nice hog through the ice.  Measured it at almost 25", and figure it was about 5lbs.  Big fat belly.  My batteries ran dead on my camera, so I only have 1 decent picture, and that's of me.  The nighttime cell phone / flashlight picture of the walleye didn't turn our good at all.  I tried to get my foot in there for a comparison..  She looks a little rough, but she swam off strong..      And of coarse the swag!.

Here are my select pics from the G2G. Randy's deer head is FREAKY!!! hahaha  Somebody got stuck right at the ice shack...heavy snow drifts everywhere    Randy and the shack    My GF jigging her heart out. haha    Randy getting in touch with the wildlife gods    Blair checking his line    Me with  a hering     Again...great times!
Really wish i was able to make it, looks like everyone had a blast..
AWESOME GLOVES BLAIR!!!!!!!  fantastic GTG people...love all the pictures...Randy...that deer head is freakin' weird and scary....love it.  So many different stories....great read.  GOOD TIMES!

Probably the last post for this thread then we can let it die. I was back out at the hut yesterday from 11:30 - 4:30 and had wayyy too much to drink. I caught 13" walleye and a buddy caught a 22.5" pike. We caught lots of perch but only kept a few for a snack in the hut. No pictures.
Speaking of way to much to drink.  If you catch a brand new mag light in that area.  let me know..
Bahahaha. Reminds me of the rod holder I lost, the jigging rod I broke, the sweater I forgot on Sat night....Next time I drink and fish I'm bringing NOTHING with me, especially if in the dark.
Swag? There was swag?  Left too soon I guess. Ah, well, maybe next time.  On another note, the Steelers lost. Green Bay's got a great team though, and you gotta love Aaron Rodgers.
Nick, didn't I tell you to use the head lamp? Which hole did it go down? I may try a big magnet I have.
If you walk straight out the door of the hut, it's the first whole you will come to..  About 20' from the hut..
Unfortunately, Mag-Lite's are made of aluminum, so that won't work.

Hahahah Great stories Guys... I have a few pic's to add too, but I'm still on the road, as soon as I'm home, I'll get them up here...  I thought that Herring tasted just like a little white fish... first time I ever tried herring...  Thanks again Blair and everyone for a great day...

Naw.. it was nice meeting you... but don't be so bashful.. He forgot to mention he threw a lot more fish back then is seen... and he got that big walleye in Randy's ONE" perch hOLE .. LOL <love teasing>  It was fun watchin you catch fish after fish...  Great day forsure..
Cant leave the children at home alone

If you can make it PM NAW for the accomodations. Maybe you two could split the room and save some cash? I am open to someone (up to 2 people) spending the night in my hut. It is warm and you would be the guinnea pig....oops...I mean first to try out the new beds. Maybe catch a biggun over night?
I would love to overnight it in your hut.  I'll bring bells for my rod, and a bottle of scotch!  Sign me up for that.  For sure!
ummmmmMMMMMMMM  SCOTCH...
See you guys on the ice tomorrow.  Is 9 AM at the gov't dock still the plan?
Yep. Still the plan. Sorry I forgot your name on the list but I edited it now. Cant wait to meet all the folks.
I'm leaving Sturgeon at 7... quick Tim's pit stop and gas ...  truck is already packed and good to go... I'd leave now if I could
You could sleep in my shack tonight if you wanted?
Lady will be there early. Just knock or her cab door. lol
EDIT:  Bushmills Irish Whiskey

Good thing I'm Irish, add a can of eagle brand/half half, chocolate ice cream syrup and a few other select ingredients and you'll have NAW's home made Irish cream. thats what I use is bushmills for home made go-go juice,well that's we call it. make a batch every X-mas.  yum yum.
My wife makes home made baileys every christmass too!

Harv and I will be at the Callander dock at 9 AM in the morning. But like I PM'ed you Nip, I can only stay till about noon. Family plans came up that mean I can't stay the whole day as I would like.  We'll have a chance to wet some lines for a couple of hours and meet some of the guys anyway.
Hey guys as it stands now i wont likly make it tomorrow not feeling all that great today, if i feel better later in the day tomorrow i will try to swing out.
I'm bringing a guest .. he's been hangin' around my place for a long time.
Damn.. I'm in Callander now... if I could only find the docks.... lol  Got me home with me too... but this Legion could be a good time as well.. lol Someone.. Tell me where to go from here plz...
The GTG is almost officially underway. Lady Walleye in now at the landing. She is the first participant and is awaiting our arrival at 9am. Game on!
Have fun people....wish i could have made it!
Good times. Report and pics to follow shortly. I have to clean the Herring smell off my hands first.

No postings on our day yet?? wow, you guys are slow... lol  It was a great day on Nip... even the weather cooperated..... and I'd like to thank Randy for getting me out on the ice.. Nipfisher for such a warm welcome feeling and a Ladies room.  NAW it was great meeting you.. an early bird just like me, and keeping me company as we waited for these Northern ppl to get out of bed..  I'll be looking for you on Simcoe, hope your stay in the hut was warm and rewarding... and everyone else .. Thank you for such great company, and filtered try again please chat, TJ.. your the best..<WINK, GIGGLE> great to see you and thanks so much for the flag for the front of my Tractor..I'll send you pic's... It surely was a great day with Randy doing his BBQ  and Nipfisher cookin up tastes of fresh Herring and Perch right on the ice...  and I'm sure NAW will be enjoying the walleye's tonight, all to himself  lol  As for the rest.. I'll leave that for Nipfisher to post......... Thanks again Guys.. We all had an awesome day...

Big thanks to Blair for the excellent hospitality (and the beer)  and of course TJ for the awesome swag (currently enjoying my mug).  The fishing was good, and the company was even better.  Always nice to meet OFC'ers

Harv and I enjoyed the outing and meeting you folks, even though we could only stay till noon. Would be nice to join something like this again some time when other things don't conflict.  Thanks for the effort in putting this all together, Blair.
A few more pics...
Excellent     Looks like a great time had by all.  Glad you made it Shelley  Joey
OK, fair enough. Not sure what is up yet next weekend but I might stop by to say hello.
5 more sleeps. Weather system looks like it will be good to us and finally get some lower pressure.
Shaping up really good for you guys! Good luck and those of you who are in our tournament, don't forget your OFC signs!

Hey guys, haven't really frequented OFC much over the past few months, but I'll be out fishing on Callander Saturday anyway, so I may as well keep a look out for you guys.  Forecast is looking promising so far.
I will move my hut later this week close to nipfisher's, please sing my guest book, I will leave it in the hut, sorry nipfisher I have not had time to get back to you, how close do you want the hut?
I CCCCant friggin' wait!!
Any where behind or to the west of my shack.
The long range is holding up nicely.  Looking forward to getting out.  Post-ice meet-up for a pint or two in Callander?
There will be some adult bevys on the ice. But I may be convinced into a drink from a local establishment.

I placed an order today for 1.5 pounds of shiners. There should be about 10-12 dozen shiners in a pound. With about 15-20 anglers this should make us good for mins.  Thank you to Discount Bait and Tackle on Trout Lake Rd. for the great deal on the minnows.
Minnows are on order and the weather is looking good.
Figured I'd repost this.
Make sure someone comes with you and you keep them seperate!! You can't possess more than 10 dozen without a collectors licence.
Yep thanks Wayne we have that covered. Spud7378 will be my driver as I'm thinking I won't be in driving condition by the end of the day.
Sorry guys, some family obligations came up and I won't be able to make it.  I might try and swing by towards the end of the day and see how everyone made out.
Sorry to hear that Mike01. My hut will be out on C-Bay all season. OFNers welcome anytime.  Loving the new forecast. High of -2. Whoooo-hoooo. That's almost t-shirt weather.
48 Hours to go!!!
Is that it? Is it -5 degrees yet?
Looks like the wind forecast has changed from 5 to 10 kph.... are we still going ahead with the G2G?
We sure are .. that's a 6Mph wind. My contraption just might work ! ..

It looks like at least 13 board members will make it out if work cooperates? Maybe a few suprise guests ???? T.J. ????? Bernie ????  Randy From Sturgeon Rodcaster Nipfisher Smarty Pantz? NAW LucG? Average Joe Fishing? Rides85 Spud7378 Buster? Bassasin Lady Walleye = Mystery member Jocko Old Harv Joeytier (sorry)  Temps are still forcasted to to be -3. Some wind and some flurries but all is good. I'll have some fresh coffee perkolating in the hut for the morning portion of the day. Looks like we will have everything we need for a great event. Thanks to Spud7378 I'll be able to enjoy a few beverages INSIDE my hut and he will get me home safe.

I'm 90% OUT. I'd have to come up friday night grab a room and spend saturday night in a room leave early sunday morn approx 3.5hr drive home for superbowl...If i go it'll be last minute decision .  Dam car has a shake in the front end I'll have to check out too..maybe a wheel weight lost, bad tire..not sure. I'll try tire rotation tomorrow.. Still want to go tho....lol  Party up with Nip and the boyz I mean serious fishing   with the boys.
Read that to say he hasn't got Shenia's permission yet !!
LOL,  the last thing this cat does is ask. The main reason I've stayed with her since I was 26 is she doesn't say no, 11  years and not once has she said NO Happily Unmarried to a 49 yr old!!!
Yah.. "10-4 good buddy.. but yah better be home before I go to work" LOL
I'd pay for that.
Buster if you can make it up here, I'll make sure you have a place to fish out of. That goes for all OFNers (just not all at once).

I got some bad news today... I thought my splint was coming off today, but it will only be in another 2 weeks   ... But i'll still try to go for a visit.  If i can't go Goodluck to all you guys... If I'd be fishing for a living i would'nt of hurt myself lol
Man down. Would be great if you still came out for a visit. Maybe you should drive for Randy? That way he can really enjoy himself.
There's an Idea!!
I'am still debating but thanks much for the   offer, I'll know more as we get closer to the date, I'd have to be back for superbowl tho

Superbowl is a definate. I'll be heading out to the shack Friday night to make sure everything is ready. Saturday at 9am we'll meet at the launch, I'll fish until dark. Sunday me and some buddies are having a Superderb from 11 am - 3 pm (longest fish wins) then a cab from the ice to a buddies place for the game. I took Monday off so after the kids are at daycare / school I'll be back out on the ice. Considering a nearby lake for Lakers. Tuesday - Thursday will be detoxing.
unless i get called into work i'll be in. i'll bring the good looks good humour and a few more dogs and buns.

It looks like at least 13 board members will make it out if work cooperates?  Randy From Sturgeon Rodcaster Nipfisher Smarty Pantz NAW LucG? Average Joe Fishing? Rides85 Spud7378 Mike01 Duckdog? Buster? Bassasin Mystery member   I know of at least 6 friends of members that will also be attending. I have some fishing buddies from the Ontario Out of Doors Community that may drop in for visits. Mike01 and Spud 7378 will have portables...who else? There is plenty of room around the shack and we can use mine as H.Q. / kitchen / washroom. Mike01 said he'd bring his auger (gas?) and I'll have my Jiffy with lots of gas. In my shack I'll have my oil furnace with cook top and a 2 burner propane stove. Randy is bringing the bar-b-q. I'll have the cooking oil and Fish Crisp and a small frying pan for some on-ice fish frying. I'll make every effort to get us enough minnows for everyone. I'll collect for bait on the ice so bring a little cash. You can drive right to my hut but no sense in having a bunch of vehicles out there. So after the first group goes out at 9am I'll take a few runs to get every body there or at least your gear and you can walk out.  Any questions just ask here or PM me. I'll have a bunch of extra lines and tip-ups too. Here is the long range forcast. Looks really fishable.  Long Range Forcast

Thanks for the PM invite, Nip!  Sounds great.  Old Harv and I will drive out to the spot with a truck if we can make it. (Snow conditions are good for a vehicle so far, I gather.)  Chances look very good, so count us in barring a message to the contrary.  We've got an Eskimo Quickfish portable, a gas auger, and all the gear necessary to set up comfy.

That makes 15 members confirmed to attend! We're just hoping for good weather and good work schedules. Duckdog has offered to pull his hut close to mine and provide me with the combination to the lock so that other OFNers can use it that day. Thnanks Duckdog.

Welcome Back ,  JOCKO!!!  I've invited Kevin from Lakair... AKA. capt_hooked.. It looks good for him and his son.  I'm looking forward to next Saturday   ----------------------------------off topic-------------  I seen a white Toyota Tacoma today in North Bay .. with plates that read FISHOFNC ????????    It must be a member ... does anyone know  their identity?
Thanks, Randy. See you there! Looking forward to it too.  Thanks for the organizing effort, Nipfisher. Would be a shame not to take advantage.
No problem Jocko. There are alot of local members that I can't wait to meet. Maybe if I share my perch and walleye with you "westerly" folk you'll share your walleye and walleye with me.
I have to wait until , next wk mon-tue for the 100% , but sitting at 90% now that I'm in.
Cool.

Hi fellas, Im new here but a little birdie told me that you guys will be fishin Nipissing soon. I JUST HAVE A COUPLE QUESTIONS.  1) Has anyone been out yet?  2) How was the bite?	Myself and a few buddies will be staying in the ice bungalows put out by Anglers Haven and are hoping to have some action!   Thanks in advance.
I have a 4 stoke auger, makes holes in about 5 sec!  And my portable can fit 3...I stress the "can" part.  Hopefully it won't be too cold.  Looking forward to meeting some fellow North Bay anglers.

Great Mike01, We should have about 5 augers between the group. Probably drill 30-40 holes through 20+ inches of ice. It is a pretty easy drive out to the shack today. we can use the trucks to get the gear out to the shack. Then take some back to the landing.
I PM'd you RathrBFishn.
Thanx Nipfisher. Got it.

Update from todays trip to the hut.  Bad news is...not much of a bite after 4:30.  Good news is....perch should keep us busy from 9-12 and 2-4:30.  Last 2 trips have not produced a single walleye. I'll leave the hut where it is for now and move it after the gtg. At least we are in a decent perch spot. With the # of anglers and 2 holes each we should be able to cover a good area and hopefully the walleye cooperate. The long term forecast looks terrific with a high of -4 and a low of -12. The pressure should be lower and some light snow is expected.  Forecast  There is an excellent road right to my hut. It will be an aesy ride out and in with the vehicles. I'm super excited about next Saturday and I'll try and keep this thread current.
Any of you fellas going to bring an FRS radio? Just in case I get a chance to pop by.

Bernie, I can give you my cell #. We should be easy to find us there. If you drive over we will be out in front of the launch (gov. dock) just off to the left. When you get on the lake there are 3 well-traveled roads. The centre one will lead you right ot my shack. Here are some pictures from today.  From the launch looking out. You can`t see road 1 in this picture.     From my hut looking back to the launch. Now you can see all 3 roads.
so far I'm still GOOD TO GO!!! and getting anxious..... BBQ tank is full .. Freedom Grill is ready .. gear is .. filed, sharpened, spooled,.........  I'm looking forward to this

I remember Callander ... a bit...   do we meet where they put the Chief Commanda II for the winter and all leave from there?  Who's bringing what?  Everyone for themselves ?  I've got a BBQ that everyone can use and a small portable shack that can be used as an outhouse

**************** Official statement ***************   We will be launching from the Callander Government dock off of Lansdown Street, in Callander. I've posted the map from Hwy 11, just zoom out to get a bigger picture.  http://maps.google.ca/maps?hl=en&xhr=t&q=google+maps&cp=2&wrapid=tljp129531857537502&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wl    ***************** unofficial statement *****************  What time should we meet up?

O.K.  Party...ooops I mean gtg....is on! Looks like we will have at least 15 participants.  We will meet at the launch at the end of Lansdowne St. in Callander for 9 am? Anyone who wants to fish earlier can get out there first. Map link is in the above post. I will bring my gas auger and I will probably have my big hut there as a resting place (it has a bathroom in it Randy). No hot dogs for you! We will be directly in front of the launch about 10  minutes out by foot. There will be tons of ice so I will also have my truck there. I may bring the old sled too. Family, friends, and kids are welcome but I am not a babysitter.  Randy, Yes it is where they store the Cheif Commanda. Please bring the bar-b-q. I'll have my Serious Radio for tunes.  I guess we need to decide on bait? I could try to arrange to get 1-2 pounds of shiners? Where we will be the Perch have been ferocious with a few walters mixed in. We also need to set some derby rules.
count me in im there!
Sounds great to me!  If I win the most fish, and the biggest fish, that would cover my gas up!  Or a few dances at the peelers

O.K. I am gonna try and move my shack all the way from Sunset Bay to Callander Bay on Sat. If the ice holds up (no pressure cracks) then I should be fine. If the shack makes it alright it will serve as the GTG H.Q.
Count me in.  I'll bring my clam and snowmobile, some extra gear and auger.
Thinking we are gonna have 20 people participating in this gtg. Who's bringing hot dogs, buns, condiments, etc?
I'll ask again...lets get some grub organized.
I'll bring the 5 pound walleye.  Count me in for a case of pop.
I'll bring a dozen burgs and buns.  A few bags of chips too..

I can bring , Oh 36 or so Dogs and some condiments... propane and the BBQ...since I'm driving home just a 6Pk for the day... I can also pick up some bags of chips ..  ...................  ************* Sturgeman and Butcher are out....  Butch has to work, drives truck for Tim Horton's........ Sturge has prior Hockey Tourney commitments........  AJF is in ....  Curlrap will be making a last minute decision... his kids are future Hockey Stars  I PM'd BassAsin and he's interested

I have also invited Jocko, and we have a "mystery" member confirmed who does not wish to give out their identity yet. I still think we will end up with somewhere around 20 participants. Lots of hot dogs!
I should be able to get out too  just gotta make sure a couple of things are done before I say yes Ill know by the middle of the week
AJF!!  WHY ARE YOU SCREAMING !!!  *edit* not sure how to use FONTS yet  **edit**  now I know...

I PM'd some hotel info. to NAW and figured it should get posted here in case another board member is looking for accomodations.  The closest hotel is Terrace Suites but that is alot of cash. Next closest is Pinewood Park (Clarion Resort) but it is expensive too. The closest cheaper hotel is the "peeler" Bar Moe-ze-on Inn (705) 494-4915.  My suggestion is one of these two places. Arizona Motel 705-472-0800 1078 Lakeshore Drive North Bay, ON http://www.arizonamotelnorthbay.com/ or The Lincoln Motel 705-472-3231 594 Lakeshore Drive North Bay, ON. http://www.lincolnmotel.net/ Both are less than 10 minutes from where we will be fishing and are affordable and comfortable.

My hut (GTG Head Quarters) is now in position. It is about a 5 minute walk from shore or you can drive right to it. There is alot of space behind the shack for portables. There is about 15" of ice under us and we are in 26.7 feet of water. Neighboring shacks today caught up to 30 perch and there were a few walleye caught. It is tough fishing with the blistering cold wind and high pressure. If the weather cooperates for us on the 5th, so will the fish.

I went back out today and did a little scouting around the shack. We are in 27 fow and there is a slope going down to 30 fow to the deep side of the shack. There will be lots of room for portables. Less then 3 hours today and Perch bite was non-stop. We landed 6 (5 perch and 1 eye) and lost several on the way up. We also got stipped alot because the holes froze over instantly, and we were inside the warm shack
Trying to keep this current. Only 11 days away. I know you're excited Randy.
Any specific jigs I should bring?  I have lots of small jig heads for perch.  And lots of Williams, badboys, swedish pimples, etc.. for Simcoe whitefish..  What else should I bring?
I had intented on bringing some deer saugage, but turns out I may need to work...not sure yet. Fingers crossed...
Nick, You are asking the wrong guy as I dead stick with my tip-ups 95% of the time (hook, split shot and lively shiner). However small spoons and jigs tipped with minnow will produce.

I will try to make it, if not my huts on Callander now and I will try to hook up with someone to allow usage of my hut if I cant make it, its a 5x8 2 manner, fishing has been real tough on Callander or I am in the wrong spot this year lol
You are probably too shallow. Try 28-30 fow and you'll get perch steady. Walleye bite is between 8 am and 11 am and then around 3:30 - 5pm.  I sent you a PM Nelson.
He went for hand surgery .. but will be fine.. He creeps around but can't post much.  I totally forgot to mention AJF in my above posts.  Randy
Just thought I'd mention the 5th is the Nosbonsing walleye derby and it is also Superbowl weekend. Any other dates we want to toss around?
Randy From Sturgeon Rodcaster Nipfisher Smarty Pantz NAW LucG Curlap Butcher Sturgeman Average Joe Fisher  buddies are welcome....but why wouldn't they want to join OFC....not like it costs anything?
Good list.  Feb the 5th still works for me.
I can still do the 5th as well. Just want everyone's input.

I'm so torn on what to do!!!!  Maybe nosbonsing in the early morn & nip in the afternoon?!?!?! Hahaha  I'll talk it over with my side kick & get back to you but nipissing would definitely be good too, decisions decisions....

O.K. it is getting close. For those of you interested in a little Nipissing get to gether let's keep this thread active. Potentially 10 participants so far.... Randy From Sturgeon Rodcaster Nipfisher Smarty Pantz NAW LucG Curlap Butcher Sturgeman Average Joe Fisher  Are we in for Callander Bay? We can bar-b-que or order pizza and fish for the afternoon and "witching hour" (4:30 - 5:30). Mini derby with $2 - $5 entry fee? If you are coming from out of town and want a place to stay, let me know and I'll see what I can do? I have the Monday off as well (Superbowl hangover) so I will fish Sun. morn and Monday too. I will offer the opportunity for some people to come to my shack on South Shore for the Monday. P.M. me or post here for info.
Go for it, ill try to attend, but no promises! Feb gonna be busy for me with the fishing show and tyler event.
What fishing show T.J.?
This one!!  http://www.springfishingandboatshow.com/

I been trying my best to keep Feb 5th weekend free.  Coming from Barrie, and not sure what to do about accommodations.  I'm cheap, so I don't want to stay in a hotel.  Thinkin about driving up Friday night, heading home Saturday night, or Sunday morning..  This just might be my chance the try winter camping..  Calendar bay is in the south east corner of the lake right??  The only thing that would stop me from coming is an emergency at work..
There are motels in North Bay for 49.99/night....Bay motel or the voyageur.  correct, callander bay is the south east end.  So far it looks like I'm still good to join
You could also stay in the motel that's joined to the peelers.. just sayin..
Mo-Z on Inn....Wayne, if he stays there he'll never make it out onto the Ice... that means that we'd have to go looking for him and then we'd never make it back onto the ice.
Just bring your own sheets..
Or a $20 bill tied to the end of your ice rod...
Callander Bay is the eastern most part of the lake. The South Bay, which consists of the South River mouth, Hunters Bay and Fish bay is south east.

Naw, I'll try and figure something out for your accomdations. I'm thinking about pulling my shack from South Shore to Callander Bay so maybe I'll have it there by then. I'll send out a few PMs to start the organizing of this thing.
Sounds good to me.  even a $50 a night hotel is good.  I didn't think you could get rooms that cheap anymore.
Keep it current.
I would be down for some fishing that weekend

O.K. it is getting close. For those of you interested in a little Nipissing get to gether let's keep this thread active. Potentially 11 participants so far....  Randy From Sturgeon Rodcaster Nipfisher Smarty Pantz NAW LucG Curlap Butcher Sturgeman Average Joe Fishing Rides85
Should I bring my snowmobile?

Randy From Sturgeon, Rod Caster, and myself (hopefully T.J. will approove) are planning a hardwater GTG on Lake Nipissing this winter. We would like to start the real planning soon, and are looking for suggestions and confirmations on who might attend. So far Saturday February 5th is the date.  I would be willing to hold a block of rooms available at a local hotel and make arrangements for some prizes. Maybe an bar-b-que on the ice could be arranged?
